alert.note: Alert for Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:01PM MDT until June 29 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PLATTE AND SOUTHEASTERN CONVERSE COUNTIES... At 201 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Esterbrook Campground, or 15 miles south of Douglas, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Platte and southeastern Converse Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 118 and 125. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern and east central Wyoming. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
